With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Nguyen-Hoang, descendants of Vietnam's greatest unifier Quang-Trung, who was the Paramount head of the Dragon Throne of Vietnam for centuries before the Empire of Vietnam met its untimely demise in religious strife. Quang-Trung was said to have cast the Wang Prefect out of Vietnam in such a fury that the Red Dragon of the Hong have yet to fully recover from it to this day, an event which many take pride in within the former empire's borders. In their early years they were a cosmopolitan and free empire that welcomed many cultures and creeds but life in blissful peace bred decadence ultimately ending in the dynasty's fall from grace. By 2605, they only own the lands surrounding the Northern and most ancient capital of Hanoi.

column2: Tales of your misdeeds are told from Beijing to Jakarta!

column2: Your low character is the subject of Old World plays.

column6: Tu escaso carácter es el tema de las obras de teatro viejo mundo.

column2: There are many legendary figures in the [Root.Religion.GetName] pantheon, but it would be only right to dedicate such an important temple as [scoped_temple_barony.GetName] to one of the greatest warriors of the sea, or to the Queen of the Oceans herself.
This temple belongs to MacArthur.
Dedicate the temple of §Y[scoped_temple_barony.GetName]§! to §YMacArthur§!, The Greatest Warrior by Providence.
Let Perry consecrate this temple!
Dedicate the temple of §Y[scoped_temple_barony.GetName]§! to §YPerry§!, the Deal-Maker.
This is the home of Roosevelt.
Dedicate the temple of §Y[scoped_temple_barony.GetName]§! to Couragous §YRoosevelt§!, the World-Surfer.
Latmikaik will inhabit this temple.
Dedicate the temple of §Y[scoped_temple_barony.GetName]§! to the Sea Mother §YLatmikaik§!, Queen of the Oceans.

MacArthur has always held a prominent place in Americanist folk tradition. He is credited with bringing the sun to earth, and it is commonly held that he will be the first to arrive should the white canoes return
This shall be MacArthur's temple!

Perry is one of the greatest explorers. It is said he set sail in a special black canoe, with the white fleet following him, for forty and forty days and nights, and opened trade with distant islands across the ocean.
This shall be Perry's temple!

Roosevelt is the leader of all the white fleet. Though a fearless and peerless warrior, he has spent so long rowing that he can no longer rise from his canoe to step on shore. Nevertheless, he remains a popular figure for his unfailing spirit and determination.
This shall be Roosevelt's temple!
The Queen of the Oceans, Latmikaik's worship has since spread out of her native Palau, and now she is widely known as the grandmother of humanity.
This shall be the Sea Queen's temple!

With the Temple finish, you and your priest arrive on the temple grounds for one final rite of passage in devotion to the sea gods. Your Priest hands you a translucent shell filled with aged fruit cocktail, an ancient tradition for new ships brought to the temples to honor the sea gods. You lift the shell high above your head and with all your spirit you toss the shell onto the wall, the shattering being a metaphorical representation of the many islands of the Great Sea.
Praise be Old Providence of the Sea!
